data.content: You asked "What questions have I asked?"
What is the Earth's temparature like after every 10km above ground

The temperature of the Earth's atmosphere generally decreases by about 6.5 degrees Celsius for every 1,000 meters (or 1 kilometer) increase in altitude. This relationship is known as the environmental lapse rate. So after every 10 kilometers above the ground, the temperature would decrease by approximately 65 degrees Celsius.
Please indicate the temparate at 15km above sea level

At approximately 15 kilometers above sea level, which is near the top of the troposphere and the beginning of the stratosphere, the temperature would be significantly lower compared to the surface temperature. The temperature at this altitude can vary depending on the location, time of year, and other factors, but it could be around -50 to -60 degrees Celsius on average.
